csw.services.events

Interface TelemetryService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TelemetryServiceImpl

    public interface TelemetryService
    API for publishing, getting and subscribing to telemetry (StatusEvent objects).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber, boolean postLastEvents)
      Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it.
      EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(scala.Function1<Events.EventServiceEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback, boolean postLastEvents)
      Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it.
      scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> delete(java.lang.String prefix)
      Deletes the given status event from the store
      scala.concurrent.Future<scala.Option<Events.StatusEvent>> get(java.lang.String prefix)
      Gets the value for the given status event prefix
      scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.Seq<Events.StatusEvent>> getHistory(java.lang.String prefix, int n)
      Gets a list of the n most recent status event values for the given prefix
      scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> publish(Events.StatusEvent status, int history)
      Publishes the status event (key is based on the event's prefix)
      EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber, boolean postLastEvents, scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
      Subscribes an actor to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.
      EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(scala.Function1<Events.StatusEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback, boolean postLastEvents, scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
      Subscribes a callback function to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> publish(Events.StatusEvent status,
                                                         int history)
        Publishes the status event (key is based on the event's prefix)

        Parameters:
        status - the value to store
        history - optional number of previous values to store
        Returns:
        a future indicating if/when the operation has completed

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
        Subscribes an actor to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(scala.Function1<Events.StatusEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
        Subscribes a callback function to events matching the given prefixes Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events.

        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • createEventMonitor

        EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                             boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • createEventMonitor

        EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(scala.Function1<Events.EventServiceEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback,
                                             boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.

        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the callback receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • get

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.Option<Events.StatusEvent>> get(java.lang.String prefix)
        Gets the value for the given status event prefix

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix (key) for the event to get
        Returns:
        the status event, if (and when) found

      • getHistory

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.collection.Seq<Events.StatusEvent>> getHistory(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                             int n)
        Gets a list of the n most recent status event values for the given prefix

        Parameters:
        prefix - the status event's prefix
        n - the max number of values to get
        Returns:
        future sequence of status events, ordered by most recent

      • delete

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> delete(java.lang.String prefix)
        Deletes the given status event from the store

        Parameters:
        prefix - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        a future indicating if/when the operation has completed
